reviewText: I have been really enjoying playing this game more so than the little ones. You get to create your own ghoul at the start and be the new ghoul in school. Making friends, doing quests, finding hidden objects around the school and/or in lockers are just some of the tasks you encounter. The environment is both rich in colour and beautiful. Achievements obtainable + trading cards included. Great game for the little ones or even yourself if you are a fan of the Monster High series or just a kid at heart. Highly recommended.

reviewText: People that give this game a bad review are being silly and a bit more critical than they should be. It is a game made for young kids so of course it is going to be dull for an older person. You go to and fro and give things to people and find secrets. It's like a kid's first well rounded game. Anyone would enjoy it if you liked Monster High.

reviewText:
I don't know anything about Monster High.  Just from the look and feel, I'm calling it MLP meets Harry Potter, but with the horror genre.  Personally, I love almost any game where I can customize a character for my avatar.  It's what made me like THUG, and Tiger Woods PGA.  So, this game starts out with that plus.  You can choose from a very large variety of monsters to be your main character.  Then you get to pick clothes (and you can buy more outfits in game) and hair-style so you can be as unique as you want to be.

The game is controller-supported, which is great.  It reminds me a lot of Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone on the PlayStation.  I haven't played too much, but you walk around school and can talk to people, and there are collectibles scattered all around for you to find, encouraging you to explore.  In addition, you can find Locker Codes scribbled on the wall to open old lockers in the hallways.  You don't even have to worry about writing them down.  They are saved in your phone, and exclamation points are placed above the lockers you found the codes for!

The graphics are smooth, and aside from a couple times when I jumped down and glitched into a box, forcing me to reset my game, everything flows well.  The atmosphere is nice, and I really dig the spooky dance-beat (probably based on the show's title music) playing in the background.

Some characters (possibly main characters?  Again, I have never seen the show to know anyone yet.) are voice-acted, and the game-makers picked good people, I think.  If you like the horror genre, and exploration/adventure games where you go on fetch-quests, and you don't mind the setting of a school and being a female, talking about monster fashion, this is a great game.  I don't think the point is story so much as just being a part of the Monster High world as a character of your own.  As a male, I am not ashamed of playing this game.

reviewText: This entire game is talking to people with poorly written lines, and having these people send you on fetch quests down the hall.  Every 30 mins or so there might be something that almost resembles gameplay in the form of a poorly designed mini game...maybe.  It's barely a game since there is no real gameplay, it's like a bad visual novel with a terrible camera that never points the way you want it to and gives you motion sickness.  Everyone is the story is some sort of undead, and you'll be wishing that whenever they died that they would have stayed that way.

reviewText:
Yes, I'm an adult male, and yes, I know what I'm playing here.
No I am not a brony, and No, I have not completely lost my ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ mind.

So why do I reccommend this game?

Because not every game has to be for the hardened gamer. I actually enjoy the Monster High cartoons for their terrible, terrible, monster-related puns, and the creative designs of the characters. This game is much the same, only this time, you get to be part of it, as the eponymous New Ghoul."

reviewText:
This Game is a nice Console Port brought to PC. It runs smooth and without any fps drops. The Graphics itself are very colourful, bright and cartoony. The Actual Story will take you 10 hours to go through and the story itself is rather rich and amazing.

The Game itself takes place in the Monster High World which is a Webispode Show and popular mostly among the younger audience. The Controls are also very easy, especially with a controller.

You will be able to costumize not only your clothes but your hair and with it your hair colour as well. Each haircut is provided with 2 differen colours. Via your iCoffin you will be able to buy even more clothes which lets you in the end create your own specific look.

All in all I can recommend this game especially for kids, if you are older than the age of 14 and you are not into Barbie or Disney or anything similiar I do not recommend you to get this game as you might think it is boring.

I also recommend this game for every achievement hunter as it is rather easy to get this a perfect game, also another + in my opinion is, this is the first game with actual achievements and trading cards.

Due to the fact that this Game is 10 hours long (or longer if you want to get all the extras) I can recommend it for its original price of 20€ but of course it is never a mistake to get it for cheaper as well.

This Game is by far one of the best Kid-games on Steam and I hope in the future there will be more such great games!

reviewText: This game is great for younger fans of the series who are also into some casual games, though it may be somewhat lacking for the more serious gamers. This game is rather reminicient of games such as Bratz: Forever Diamondz in how the character moves and interacts, as well as the phone mechanic for tracking objectives and other things. I'd highly reccomend using a controller for this game however; since the camera controls are extremely difficult to get over without it. If at all possible, I'd also reccomend turning down your controller sensitivity, as the movement controls are very sensitive and could cause a lot of annoyance in the platforming puzzles.

reviewText: I thought this was a really cute game at firsts, it's a bit redundent, but what can you expect I guess. But then I ran into multiple glitches and issues. Then it began to crash and freeze REPETEDLY to the point it froze my whole computer. My computer has played much higher frame rate games and i have a pretty good system. Maybe this game would work better in it's console versions. Just be wary. But despite the technical issues the game is not fun. I gave it the best chance I could. But all you do is run errands for NPC characters with no real plot. Just be super wary

reviewText: Ok I hate to do this, because I like Monster High, but...I do not recommend this game. It looks like it should, but it plays terrible. Your newsfeed breaks, causing a crash to desk top very early in the game, while I was able to get past this *kind of* it again crashed to desk top in the news feed while I was reading things. Also the physics, not just a little janky, but making objects the move milimeters at a time is just bad.\nI think this game may in fact have been programmed BY high school students, or less, and thats a shame as it looks pretty good for being a cartoon based game.\nI would like to see more deveopment for Monster High games, but the quality *MUST* improve, as this was dreadful.

reviewText:
Really fun game!
It was a nice casual break from more difficult games. I'm a huge fan of Monster High (and Ever After High), so this was perfect!
I beat it with 100% after just over 13 hours of gameplay. Regardless, I have a feeling this will be a game that I'll continuously replay and go back to since it's so fun.

I do wish that the Art Room wasn't boarded up. Not sure why it's there, but you can't access it (unless you can in the console versions. I don't know).

Regardless, it was very fun and clever. The story felt right at home with a Monster High movie, and they included a ton of characters. The map is perfect, and really makes you feel like you're in Monster High.
